node.title: It's just been declared but what is a La Niña and what does it mean for our weather?
node.alt: Map of Pacific Ocean showing warm waters in the west and cool in the east
node.description: Invisible to us mere mortals on the ground, the atmosphere is full of giant circulations which transport, mix and disperse air and energy around the world.
node.content:
["Invisible to us mere mortals on the ground, the atmosphere is full of giant circulations which\u00a0transport, mix\u00a0and disperse air and energy around the world.", "One of these giant eddies is called the Walker Circulation.", "The Walker Circulation strides the Pacific Ocean, rising in the west in the warm waters near Australia, pushing up and over the Pacific and\u00a0descending near South America before\u00a0racing\u00a0back across the Pacific Ocean to form\u00a0the trade winds.", "", "
Under normal conditions the Walker Circulation drives the trade winds across from the east to the west of the Pacific.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "La Ni\u00f1a is the term used to describe\u00a0when the Walker Circulation is on steroids.", "The western Pacific is\u00a0even warmer than usual, the trade winds are stronger and all this moist energetic air is pushed onto Australia.", "", "
When there is a La Nina the Walker Circulation intensifies bringing wet and warm conditions to Australia.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "La Ni\u00f1a is therefore typically associated with wetter than average conditions for northern and eastern Australia, particularly in winter, spring and early summer.\u00a0", "When the Walker Circulation is weakened, or even reversed, it is called the\u00a0El Ni\u00f1o.\u00a0", "", "
When there is an El Nino the Walker Circulation is reversed and downward pushing air brings dry conditions to Australia.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology )
", "With the air now rising near South America and falling over the cooler-than-average oceans near Australia, less moisture is available and lift is discouraged, often resulting in drier than average conditions for northern and eastern Australia.\u00a0", "
What's in a name?\u00a0
", "Together La Ni\u00f1a and El Ni\u00f1o are often referred\u00a0to as\u00a0the El Ni\u00f1o Southern Oscillation\u00a0or ENSO.\u00a0", "The name El Ni\u00f1o was coined\u00a0by South American fishermen in the 1600's\u00a0who noticed\u00a0unusually warm waters that often peaked around Christmas time.", "They named the phenomena after 'El Ni\u00f1o de Navidad' after the Christ Child.\u00a0", "This evolved into just El Ni\u00f1o, 'the boy' and La Ni\u00f1a, 'the girl' to describe the opposite phase.\u00a0", "For any real keen weather watchers out there, there is another ENSO phase called El Ni\u00f1o Modoki. Where Modoki means 'same but different' in Japanese.", "Or more boringly referred\u00a0to as a Central Pacific\u00a0El Ni\u00f1o.\u00a0", "This phase is when the air rises in the centre of the Pacific descending on both sides and discouraging rain.", "
What does La Ni\u00f1a mean for Australia?
", "Straight off the bat, no two\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a events are exactly the same.", "La Ni\u00f1a conditions don't cause any one individual downpour,\u00a0rather they stack the underlying conditions full of moisture for when any individual weather event does come\u00a0along.\u00a0", "", "
La Ni\u00f1a's impact on summer rainfall is, in general,\u00a0relatively less than it is in winter and spring but as it combines with the typical wet season for much of the north\u00a0it can\u00a0still help make things pretty wet.\u00a0(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology)
", "La Ni\u00f1a summers are therefore typically wetter than average and the warmer oceans also favour tropical cyclones.\u00a0", "The increased rainfall also results\u00a0in increases in\u00a0mosquito-borne diseases.\u00a0", "Big\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a events of the past include the 1973 to 1976 La Ni\u00f1a, which was\u00a0the longest sustained period of La Ni\u00f1a on record.\u00a0", "1974 still stands as Australia's wettest year on record and 1973 and 1975 also made the top five.\u00a0", "", "
Brisbane's CBD was inundated in January 1974.(Royal Historical Society of Queensland)
", "Perhaps the most memorable event from these years was when Cyclone Wanda flooded Brisbane in the January of 1974.\u00a0", "More recently,\u00a02010 to 2012\u00a0is notable for having two big\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a summers in a row.\u00a0", "2010 and 2011\u00a0combined, resulted in the wettest 24 months on record.\u00a0", "Flooding was widespread from spring 2010\u00a0through to the end of summer 2011 \u2014 up and down the east coast.", "Horror flash flooding washed away Grafton in South East Queensland's Lockyer Valley and Brisbane again went under water.\u00a0", "", "
Lang Park under water during the 2011 floods.(Nearmap.com)
", "As these examples demonstrate, having two\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a years in a row is fairly common.\u00a0", "This year's La Ni\u00f1a is again following on from one last year.\u00a0", "But thankfully\u00a0this combination is not expected to be\u00a0as extreme as these big events of the past.\u00a0", "
How does La Ni\u00f1a impact the world?\u00a0
", "La Ni\u00f1a typically also brings wetter than average conditions to the nations north of Australia in our\u00a0summer.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
La Ni\u00f1a has flow-on effects that impact rainfall in many regions around the world.(Supplied: International Research Institute for Climate and Society Columbia University)
", "A\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a will typically lead to drier than average conditions for the southern US over their winter.\u00a0", "A study published in Nature found ENSO may have had a role in 21 per cent of all civil conflicts between 1950 and 2004, and that new civil conflicts in the tropics were twice as likely to arise during El Ni\u00f1o years than La Ni\u00f1a.", "
La Ni\u00f1a and El Ni\u00f1o are\u00a0not the only drivers
", "ENSO is only one\u00a0of\u00a0a set of climate systems\u00a0that affect Australia.", "The Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) is the other main year-to-year driver that influences Australia.", "It gained household notoriety recently after its persistent positive phase took\u00a0most of the blame for the drought that\u00a0culminated in the 2019/2020 fires.\u00a0", "But the Pacific Decadal Oscillation (PDO), the Southern Annular Mode\u00a0(SAM), and the Madden Julian Oscillation (MJO), all play a part.", "", "
These are just some of the climate influences on Australia as explained by the Bureau of Meteorology.(Supplied: Bureau of Meteorology )
", "These drivers can work to counter each other out or enhance the overall impact, as has been the case this spring as the developing\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a and the decaying negative IOD have combined to encourage rain.\u00a0\u00a0", "These drivers are happening on top of the backdrop of climate change, with seasonal changes and individual systems in the foreground.", "It is a wonderfully complex world out there.\u00a0"]
